Package Main.MVC

Class BrickBreaker

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
Main.MVC.BrickBreaker
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class BrickBreaker
extends javax.swing.JComponent
Public class BrickBreaker is responsible for loading in the GameEngine to start generating the game. The gamer timer is also started and loops through update and draw cycles to simulate gameplay. Game listeners can be found here, and they keep track of the key inputs and mouse inputs on the pause menu. The detection boxes for the pause menu options are created here. The DebugConsole is also created here.
Since:
28/11/2021
Version:
1.0
Author:
TanZhunXian
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • BrickBreaker

      public BrickBreaker​(javax.swing.JFrame owner, int[][] choice, GameSounds gameSounds, java.awt.Dimension area) throws java.io.IOException
      This constructor is used to start the game by calling the GameEngine. The game timer is also started to start the update and draw cycles. Game listeners are also added to keep track and respond to user inputs. The DebugConsole is also loaded in.
      Parameters:
      owner - The JFrame screen used to center the DebugConsole and the game.
      choice - The custom choice of the player in customising the game levels.
      gameSounds - The BGM and sound effects of the game.
      area - The area of the game screen to draw the pause menu.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - This constructor throws IOException if game background image is not found.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      This method is used to add listeners to the JFrame to receive player inputs for the game.

    • paint

      public void paint​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      This method is used to draw the graphics for the entire game. The game renderer is called from here to render the game. The detection boxes for the pause menu options are also drawn here.
      Overrides:
      paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
      Parameters:
      g - This parameter is used to get the graphics to draw the game.

    • onLostFocus

      public void onLostFocus()
      This method is used to signal to the game that the focus is lost and to show the focus lost message and pause the game.
